title: Lupita Nyong'o shines in abstract-patterned dress as she appears
text:
She's an Oscar-winning actress.

But Lupita Nyong'o appeared on the Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon to showcase her talents as an author and a freestyle rapper on Monday.

The 36-year-old screen star donned a pencil dress with an abstract print in blue and white for the talk show appearance.

Pretty: Lupita Nyong'o appeared on the Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon to showcase her talents as an author and a freestyle rapper on Monday

Her braided locks were lifted into a flirty high ponytail and she made her way on-stage in a pair of white strappy heels.

Lupita amplified her natural beauty with pink blush and a swipe of wine red lip color.

She accessorized with a few golden rings and a pair of circle-shaped earrings with a single dangling bead.

Front-and-center: The 36-year-old screen star donned a pencil dress with an abstract print in blue and white for the talk show appearance

Promo: Sulwe is 'a powerful, moving picture book about colorism, self-esteem, and learning that true beauty comes from within,' according to a statement by the publisher

Coming soon: Little Monsters is a tongue-in-cheek cross between a rom-com and a horror flick that centers on a teacher and a kids show personality's fight to protect young children from zombies

The 5ft 5in beauty is in the middle of a press blitz for her new children's book Sulwe as well as her upcoming Hulu feature film Little Monsters.

Sulwe is 'a powerful, moving picture book about colorism, self-esteem, and learning that true beauty comes from within,' according to a statement by the publisher.

Of the book, Lupita said in a statement: 'Sulwe is a character near and dear to my heart, and seeing her brought to life through Vashti’s illustrations is thrilling.'

Little Monsters is a tongue-in-cheek cross between a rom-com and a horror flick that centers on a teacher and a kids show personality's fight to protect young children from zombies.

In character: Lupita made the crowd roar during her interview when she introduced 'Troublemaker,' her freestyle-rapping, cat-eye sunglasses-wearing alter-ego

Lupita made the crowd roar during her interview when she introduced 'Troublemaker,' her freestyle-rapping, cat-eye sunglasses-wearing alter-ego.

'That's a dope beat,' she said as she began to vibe with the beat The Roots played in the background.

That was when the actress threw down some rhymes that included a shout-out to Jay-Z and Beyoncé for referencing her on the Lion King soundtrack song Brown Skin Girl as well as a plug for her new book.

Sulwe drops on Oct. 15, while Little Monsters will debut on Hulu on Oct. 11.
